page.title: 03Primary Education in Trefriw
page.content: The Trefriw Primary School, just on the boundary, was built in 1902 and has 72 pupils, 33 under 7 and 39 over 7years. The school is bilingual with 14 Welsh speaking children, 52 non-Welsh speaking Welsh children and 6 English children. Subjects include mathematics, environmental studies, arts and crafts, physical education, and general subjects.Equipment includes a colour TV, a spirit duplicator, a disc drive computer with printer, an overhead projector, a radio cassette player and a projector. A nursery school for children aged 2 to 4, is held twice a week at the school house, once the home of the Headmaster,instruction being in the Welsh language by two paid helpers. A children's clinic is held monthly.
